thread.title: Champagne to stand for Fifa top job
thread.title_full: Champagne to stand for Fifa top job

title: Champagne to stand for Fifa top job
text: Champagne to stand for Fifa top job Friday, 23 October 2015 (15 minutes ago) Former adviser to Sepp Blatter, Jerome Champagne, says he intends to run for the Fifa presidency in time for Monday's deadline. Europe's soccer governing body UEFA stand by the organisation's president Michel Platini despite his suspension by the ethics committee at FIFA. Recent related news After previously withdrawing his candidacy through lack of support last time around, the former French diplomat is ready to stand again Goal.com 38 minutes ago - Sports • Former ExCo member submits official paperwork ahead of next year’s election • ‘We need to save Fifa and its role of governance and... guardian.co.uk 2 hours ago - Sports A senior FIFA official called into question Michel Platini's bid for football's top job, saying the failure to disclose a multi-million dollar payment could be... Zee News 2 days ago - Sports Also reported by • DNA • Bangkok Post FIFA’s executive committee ruled on Tuesday, without mentioning Platini by name, that candidates for the top job who are suspended were not eligible to run. NYTimes.com 3 days ago - Sports ZURICH - FIFA's executive committee gathered for Tuesday's crisis meeting as potential candidates consider standing for the presidency next February to claim the... Bangkok Post 3 days ago - World Asian Football Confederation chief Shaikh Salman says "senior" figures have asked him to run for the Fifa presidency. BBC Sport 3 days ago - Sports Sheikh Salman al-Khalifa's push for the presidency - revealed by Sky sources - may spell the end for Michael Platini's chances.
